title: Multi-Site Analysis for Independent Data Sources
text: process exploratory analysis cross-sectional longitudinal configurations. First, execute either Single Site, Exploratory analyses, configured appropriately study, data source. , combine results single table different sites delineated site column.
code: library(sourceconceptvocabularies)  my_table <- scv_process(cohort = cohort,                         multi_or_single_site = 'single',                         anomaly_or_exploratory = 'exploratory',                         time = T / F,                         ...) my_final_results <- my_table1 %>% dplyr::union(my_table2) ... %>%   dplyr::union(my_table_n) %>%   dplyr::mutate(output_function = '{see table above}')

title: Multi-Site Analysis for Independent Data Sources
text: anomaly detection analysis, start executing steps exploratory analysis. , execute relevant anomaly detection algorithm resulting table. See different processes cross-sectional longitudinal analysis.

title: Multi-Site Analysis for Independent Data Sources
text: cross-sectional analysis, compute_dist_anomalies detect_outliers functions, available squba.gen package, executed results. Copy code , inputting table generated. standard CDM codes provided (code_type = 'cdm'): - prop_col = concept_prop - var_col = concept_id - denom_col = denom_concept_ct source codes provided (code_type = 'source'): - prop_col = source_prop - var_col = source_concept_id - denom_col = denom_source_ct p_value can selected user.
code: # First execute the compute_dist_anomalies function df_start <- compute_dist_anomalies(df_tbl = my_table,                                    grp_vars = c('domain', 'source_concept_id', 'concept_id'),                                    var_col = prop_col,                                    denom_cols = c(var_col, denom_col))  # Then, use that output as input for the detect_outliers function df_final <- detect_outliers(df_tbl = df_start,                             tail_input = 'both',                             p_input = p_value,                             column_analysis = prop_col,                             column_variable = c('concept_id', 'source_concept_id')) %>%   dplyr::mutate(output_function = '{see table above}')

title: Multi-Site Analysis for Independent Data Sources
text: longitudinal analysis, ms_anom_euclidean function, available squba.gen package, executed results. Copy code , inputting data generated. standard CDM codes provided (code_type = 'cdm'), prop_col set concept_prop. source codes provided (code_type = 'source'), prop_col set source_prop.
code: df <- ms_anom_euclidean(fot_input_tbl = csd_tbl,                         grp_vars = c('site', 'concept_id', 'source_concept_id'),                         var_col = prop_col) %>%   dplyr::mutate(output_function = '{see table above}')

title: Base SCV function — check_code_dist
text: cohort table cohort members least site, person_id, start_date, end_date concept_set analyses time = FALSE, csv file source cdm codes interest analysis. contain least concept_id column   code_type type code examined check; either source cdm code_domain domain related codes concept_set; match domain associated metadata domain_tbl file time logical indicate whether user like examine mappings time omop_or_pcornet Option run function using OMOP PCORnet CDM default CDM domain_tbl table list domains associated metadata; include name domain, name column source codes can found, name column CDM codes can found, date column used time computations
code: for analyses where time = TRUE, a vector with up to 5 source or cdm codes of interest for the analysis.

title: Base SCV function — check_code_dist
text: one dataframe counts proportions source -> cdm cdm -> source mapping pairs facet group. time = FALSE, counts computed overall. time = TRUE, counts computed user-specified time increment.

title: SCV Sample Domain File — scv_domain_file
text: data frame 5 columns domain name CDM table associated domain concept interest can found. match domain listed concept_set file. concept_field name column domain table contains concepts interest source_concept_field name column domain table contains source concepts interest date_field name column domain table contains dates used time-based filtering. vocabulary_field (PCORnet ) name column domain table vocabulary type stored

title: Multi-Site, Anomaly, Cross-Sectional — scv_ms_anom_cs
text: process_output dataframe output scv_process code_type type code used analysis – either source cdm; match code_type provided running scv_process facet variables like facet graph filter_concept code_type concept_id interest display mappings num_mappings integer indicating number top mappings displayed large_n boolean indicating whether large N visualization, intended high volume sites, used; defaults FALSE large_n_sites vector site names can optionally generate filtered visualization

what: Source and Concept Vocabularies – Output Generation — scv_output
title: Source and Concept Vocabularies – Output Generation — scv_output
text: Using tabular output generated scv_process, function build graph visualize results. function configuration output bespoke ggplot. Theming can adjusted user graph output using + theme(). graphs can also made interactive using make_interactive_squba()

title: Source and Concept Vocabularies – Output Generation — scv_output
code: scv_output(   process_output,   code_type,   filter_concept = NULL,   filter_mapped = NULL,   num_codes = 10,   num_mappings = 25,   vocab_tbl = NULL,   large_n = FALSE,   large_n_sites = NULL )

title: Source and Concept Vocabularies – Output Generation — scv_output
text: process_output tabular input || required tabular output produced scv_process code_type string || required string identifying type concept provided concept_set. match whatever provided executing scv_process function. Acceptable values cdm (standard, mapped code included CDM) source ("raw" concept source system) filter_concept (integer string) vector || defaults NULL integer/string (depending data model) vector concepts (provided concept_set scv_process) appear output. parameter required following check types: Single Site, Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional Multi-Site, Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional Multi-Site, Exploratory, Longitudinal Single Site, Anomaly Detection, Longitudinal Multi-Site, Anomaly Detection, Longitudinal filter_mapped integer string || defaults NULL integer/string (depending data model) representing mapping associated filter_concept, appears output. parameter required following check types: Multi-Site, Anomaly Detection, Longitudinal num_codes integer || defaults 10 integer indicating top N concepts (code_type) displayed plot. parameter required following check types: Single Site, Exploratory, Cross-Sectional Multi-Site, Exploratory, Cross-Sectional Single Site, Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional num_mappings integer || defaults 25 integer indicating top N mappings associated concept code_type displayed plot. parameter required following check types: Single Site, Exploratory, Cross-Sectional Single Site, Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional Multi-Site, Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional Single Site, Exploratory, Longitudinal Multi-Site, Exploratory, Longitudinal Multi-Site, Anomaly Detection, Longitudinal vocab_tbl tabular input || optional vocabulary table containing concept names provided codes (ex: OMOP concept table) large_n boolean || defaults FALSE Multi-Site analyses, boolean indicating whether large N visualization, intended high volume sites, used. visualization produce high level summaries across sites, option add specific site comparators via large_n_sites parameter. large_n_sites vector || defaults NULL large_n = TRUE, vector site names can add site-level information plot comparison across high level summary information.

title: Source and Concept Vocabularies – Output Generation — scv_output
text: function produce graph visualize results scv_process based parameters provided. default output typically static ggplot gt object, interactive elements can activated passing plot make_interactive_squba. detailed description output specific check type, see PEDSpace metadata repository

title: Source and Concept Vocabularies – Output Generation — scv_output
Source and Concept Vocabularies — scv_process
text: concept-set testing module compute frequency distributions usage either source--concept concept--source concept pairs order highlight mapping patterns impacts concept standardization. user provide domain definitions (domain_tbl) concept set concepts interest (concept_set). Sample versions inputs included data package accessible sourceconceptvocabularies::. Results can optionally stratified site, age group, /time. function compatible OMOP PCORnet CDMs based user's selection.

title: Source and Concept Vocabularies — scv_process
code: scv_process(   cohort,   concept_set,   omop_or_pcornet,   domain_tbl = sourceconceptvocabularies::scv_domain_file,   code_type,   code_domain,   jaccard_index = FALSE,   multi_or_single_site = "single",   anomaly_or_exploratory = "exploratory",   p_value = 0.9,   age_groups = NULL,   time = FALSE,   time_span = c("2012-01-01", "2020-01-01"),   time_period = "year" )

title: Source and Concept Vocabularies — scv_process
text: cohort tabular input || required cohort used data quality testing. table contain, minimum: site | character | name(s) institutions included cohort person_id / patid | integer / character | patient identifier start_date | date | start cohort period end_date | date | end cohort period Note start end dates included table used limit search window analyses module. concept_set tabular input vector || required analyses time = FALSE, input table containing standard CDM concepts source concepts interest analysis. input contain least one following: concept_id | integer | concept_id interest (required OMOP) concept_code | character | code interest (required PCORnet) certain PCORnet applications, also contain vocabulary_id | character | vocabulary code, match listed domain table's vocabulary_field analyses time = TRUE, input vector 5 standard CDM source concepts interest analysis. limitation applied reduce computational strain. recommend running cross-sectional analysis first identify potential concepts interest, using input longitudinal analysis. omop_or_pcornet string || required string, either omop pcornet, indicating CDM format data domain_tbl tabular input || required table defines domains concepts identified. input contain: domain | character | name CDM table concepts can identified concept_field | character | name field CDM table standard cdm codes can identified (.e. drug_concept_id dx) source_concept_field | character |  name field CDM table source codes can identified (.e. drug_source_concept_id raw_dx) date_field | character | name field CDM table used temporal filtering vocabulary_field | character | PCORnet applications, name field domain table vocabulary identifier differentiate concepts one another (ex: dx_type); can set NA OMOP applications see example input, see ?sourceconceptvocabularies::scv_domain_file code_type string || required string identifying type concept provided concept_set. Acceptable values cdm (standard, mapped code included CDM) source ("raw" concept source system) code_domain string || required string name domain concepts can identified. input match least one domains domain_tbl, function filter table relevant domain allow user store multiple domains table reuse analyses. jaccard_index boolean || defaults FALSE boolean indicating whether Jaccard index computed visit level determine often two mapped concepts cooccur encounter. computation can help identify potential instances post-coordination SNOMED concepts. applicable Single Site, Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional check. multi_or_single_site string || defaults single string, either single multi, indicating whether single-site multi-site analysis executed anomaly_or_exploratory string | Option conduct exploratory anomaly detection analysis. Exploratory analyses give high level summary data examine fact representation within cohort. Anomaly detection analyses specialized identify outliers within cohort. p_value numeric || defaults 0.9 p value used threshold Multi-Site, Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional analysis age_groups tabular input || defaults NULL like stratify results age group, create table CSV file following columns use input parameter: min_age | integer | minimum age group (.e. 10) max_age | integer | maximum age group (.e. 20) group | character | string label group (.e. 10-20, Young Adult, etc.) like stratify age group, leave NULL time boolean || defaults FALSE boolean indicate whether execute longitudinal analysis time_span vector - length 2 || defaults c('2012-01-01', '2020-01-01') vector indicating lower upper bounds time series longitudinal analyses time_period string || defaults year string indicating distance dates within specified time_span. Defaults year, time periods month week also acceptable

title: Source and Concept Vocabularies — scv_process
